CatDescriptText: Mr. Charles Smith, waiter, Hill District and Mrs. Michael Buccie, housewife, Mt. Washington, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 14, 1962, pg. 17 with question: "Do you think it is ethical or right for a doctor to go on 'strike' as a protest?"  Mr. Smith's answer reads: "No.  How will people he cared for?  It's a doctor's duty to tend those who are sick."  Mrs. Buccie's answer reads: "No.  Definitely not.  It's against the oath they take when they become doctors.  It is a defection from their purpose."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Charles Smith wearing hat with striped band and sunglasses, standing  in front of light colored building; Portrait of Mrs. Michael Buccie wearing sleeveless patterned dress and eyeglasses, carrying paper bag, standing on sidewalk in front of row of store fronts
